scenes.audio: Subtitles available! Subtítulos disponíveis!
scenes.visuals:
The title card displays “Subtitles available! Subtítulos disponíveis!” with six flags of countries where these subtitles are available including the United Kingdom, Portugal, Spain, Andorra, Italy, and Germany. Below, a video player loads a black screen with a controls bar below. At the bottom right is a pop-up menu displaying different subtitle options. Below the title and above the player, the text reads “Subtitles
in Neolatin:
(Select Latin)”. A flag of Macedonia is shown to the left.

scenes.audio: El interlingua, una lengua panrománica.
scenes.visuals: A graphic depicts a thinking emoji with a question mark next to it. The graphic shows the flags of Spain, Andorra, France, Romania, Italy, and Portugal pointing to a center flag representing Interlingua (IALA).

scenes.audio: Non
scenes.visuals: A large X takes up the screen. The text “NON!” appears below the X.

scenes.audio: É possibile que habias audito parlare de una lingua clamata interlingua.
scenes.visuals: A man is recording himself with a lavalier microphone against a green screen background.

scenes.audio: Interlingua (IALA)
scenes.visuals: The flag of Interlingua is shown in the center of the screen with the text “Interlingua (IALA)” printed below.

scenes.audio: Artículos, comentarios e vídoes en línea sobre questa incredibile lengua che connecta facilmente las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. In between, the screen displays YouTube video comments and a video by BBC News Mundo in Interlingua.

scenes.audio: Que plús se pote perdere?
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Bene, questo non è toto.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Plús specificamente, pare que i ha una mala comprensione dello che realmente è lo interlingua.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Allora, che è veramente lo interlingua?
scenes.visuals:
The text “QUE ÉST
VERAMENTE
LO INTERLINGUA?” appears against a yellow background.

scenes.audio: Lo interlingua è una lengua auxiliare internazionale desviluppata per la American International Auxiliary Language Association o IALA, basata sobre las lenguas europeas populares através de loro radices gregas e latinas compartidas e en menore misura, origines indoeuropeos.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. The screen then shows the title page of a dictionary called “Interlingua-English” against a mauve background. To the right of the title page, the following text appears: “"The international vocabulary has absorbed materials of the most varied origins but its center of gravity lies in the sphere of the Greco-Latin tradition…
…This group is the Anglo-Romance group of languages with German and Russian as potential contributors."
-Interlingua-English: A Dictionary of the International Language”.

scenes.audio: There are a good many instances of English words of Germanic origin which are related to words in the other control languages by Indo-European cognateship.
scenes.visuals:
The same image of “Interlingua-English” dictionary is shown as the previous keyframe. The text to the right reads: “"There are a good many instances of English words of Germanic origin which are related to words in the other control languages by Indo-European cognateship."
-Interlingua-English: A Dictionary of the International Language”.

scenes.audio: Fu creato por essere una lengua planificata artificiale che si assemblasse a las lenguas naturale, rendéndola facilmente comprensibile a prima vista.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. Cartoon eyes have been superimposed over his eyes.

scenes.audio: Questo è un contrasto con una lengua semelhante, lo esperanto, che fu creato por essere una lengua facile de apprender, mais allo costo de la intelligibilitate instantànea.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The screen then displays the flag of Esperanto and its name below.

scenes.audio: De plus, lo che distingue lo interlingua dello esperanto fu una metodologia científica che determináo suo desviluppamento.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: La IALA usáo quattro lenguas principales de contróllo por determinare suo vocabulario e gramática.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: 4 (QUATTRO) LENGUAS DE CONTRÓLLO
scenes.visuals: The title text reads: “4 (QUATTRO) LENGUAS DE CONTRÓLLO”.

scenes.audio: Lo francese, lo italiano, lo españñól e lo portughese, tractatos como una sola unitate, debuto a loro similitudes e finalmente lo anglese.
scenes.visuals: Four flags appear one after the other on the screen: France, Italy, Spain, and Portugal. Above them, the text reads “1 (UNA) UNITATE”. The flag of the United Kingdom then appears on the right.

scenes.audio: 2 (DOAS) LENGUAS SECUNDARIAS DE CONTRÓLLO
scenes.visuals: The title card reads “2 (DOAS) LENGUAS SECUNDARIAS DE CONTRÓLLO”.

scenes.audio: En menore mesura, la IALA tambéen consultáo las lenguas secondaries de contróllo: lo alemanno e lo russo.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. Two flags are shown on the screen, one each of Germany and Russia.

scenes.audio: Secondo suo principio de internationalitate, lo alemanno e lo russo se poterían sostituire por una lengua principale.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The screen then shows the flags of France, Italy, Spain and Portugal, and the United Kingdom in the first row. Below are the flags of Germany and Russia in the second row.

scenes.audio: Allora, ja videmos que varias lenguas non romànicas han influenziato lo interlingua, perché lo interlingua fu conceputo por la comunicazione internazionale generale.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The screen then shows the flags of France, Germany, Spain and Portugal, and the United Kingdom in the first row. The flags of Italy and Russia are placed below. The second row flags have switched places with the first row.

scenes.audio: Nonostante, se entrare troppo en dettaglios, la maggiore parte del vocabulario, malgrado la influenza de lenguas non romànicas, como lo anglese, termináo provenendo dello latino clássico e de lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Latino: delicātus.
scenes.visuals: The text “Latino: delicātus” appears on the screen along with two Spanish and two British flags. The first Spanish flag is next to the word “Delgado”. The second Spanish flag is next to “Delicado”. Both British flags are next to the words “Slim, Thin” and “Delicate”. The text “(Paraula hereditata)” is written below “Delgado” and “(Présto)” below “Delicado”.

scenes.audio: Por fachere un esempio, lo españñól ha la parola hereditata delgado e lo présto latino delicado, cada uno co lo proprio significato.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The words “delgado” and “delicado” are underlined, one by one, in the previous keyframe.

scenes.audio: Nonostante, quando se tratta della grammatica dello interlingua, la historia è molto diferente.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: La morfologia era tale che si estava absente una sola característica grammaticale la excludieron.
scenes.visuals: The Interlingua flag is shown on the screen.  The flags of France, Italy, Spain and Portugal, and the United Kingdom are shown in a row below. The first three flags have a green checkmark, whereas the last flag has a red x.  The word RESULTATO appears on the screen, along with a red X.

scenes.audio: Permettete essere claro.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. Cartoon eyes have been superimposed over his eyes.

scenes.audio: La grammatica non fu determinata per las características della maggioria, mais plussosto, per lo denominatore commune de las características compartidas per totas las lenguas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. Cartoon eyes have been superimposed over his eyes.

scenes.audio: Como resultado, lo interlingua aripau ha de avere una gramática europea media stàndarde o en altres parolas, una dramática che se assemblava a las características de base de las principales lenguas europeas.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. The screen then shows the cover of "Manifesto de Interlingua" with a large "i" at the center against a mauve background. To the right is the following text: “"Le plus efficace manière de formuler iste conception ha essite, jusque nunc, le tentativa de identificar interlingua con lo que le philologo american Benjamin Lee Wharf ha appellate le europeo medie standard." 
-Manifesto de Interlingua”

scenes.audio: De facto, uno de los creadores dello interlingua Alexander Gode aveva descritto la grammatica dello interlingua asi.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Sopratotto, la gramática dello interlingua fu enormemente simplificata en comparazione con la gramática de las lenguas romànicas, a causa de la influencia dello anglese.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Plus sobre questo plús tarde…
scenes.visuals: The text “Plus sobre questo plus tarde…” appears against a black background.

scenes.audio: Allora, comparemos lo interlingua con altro progetto: lo romance neolatino o semplicemente lo neolatino.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. The text “LO OBJECTIVO” appears against a yellow background with a drawing of a target and an arrow next to it. The image on the screen then shows the Neolatino flag at the center with the flags of Spain, Andorra, France, Romania, Italy, and Portugal pointing towards it. The text under the flag reads “ROMANCE NEOLATINO
(NEOLATINO)”.

scenes.audio: Lo neolatino è una lengua panromànica, una lengua creata specificamente por unire las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The graphic depicts a thinking emoji with a question mark next to it. The graphic shows the flags of Spain, Andorra, France, Romania, Italy, and Portugal pointing to a center flag representing Neolatino.

scenes.audio: Questo significa che, a differenza de lenguas como lo interlingua, una lengua internazionale generale, lo neolatino facilita la comunicazione entre parlantes de solo lenguas romànicas, sene una influenza significativa per parte de lenguas non romànicas, como lo anglese.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. In between shots, the screen shows a YouTube video titled “International Congress of Romance Neolatino (Urbino 2022) - COMPLETE EVENT”. The description of the video below reads:
“#neolatino #languaged
Jan van Steenbergen, Jordi Cassany Bates and Romance Neolatino enthusisasts are discussing the evolution of the Neolatino language and its current state
More information about the congress at neolatino.eu”.

scenes.audio: Como breve nota, si alcuna vece has audito parlare dello intereslavo, una lengua por parlantes de lenguas eslavas, lo neolatino è lo mesmo, mais por parlantes de lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. The flag of Interslav appears in the center of the screen with the text “Intereslavo
Međuslovjansky
Меджусловјанскы” printed below. Then eight other flags appear in a row to the right of the Interslav flag and below the text “Por lenguas eslavas”. Below the Interslav flag is the Neolatino flag with the text “ROMANCE NEOLATINO
(NEOLATINO)” below and the flags of Portugal, Spain, Andorra, France, Romania, Italy, and the UK in a row to the right under the text “Por lenguas románicas”.

scenes.audio: De facto, Jan van Steenbergen, uno de los creadores dello intereslavo, incluso asistéo allo congresso en 2022.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The video from earlier with Jan van Steenbergen is shown briefly again.

scenes.audio: Allora, lo obbiettivo dello interlingua è plús general, mentre che lo neolatino fu creato solo por parlantes de lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Como resultado dello obbiettivo único delo neolatino, lo neolatino è molto plús semelhante a las lenguas romànicas modernas, mantenéndo suo carattere romànico.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Allora, comparémos suo vocabulario.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: LO VOCABULARIO
scenes.visuals: The text “LO VOCABULARIO” appears on the screen with a drawing of an open book next to it against a dark blue background.

scenes.audio: En la maggiore parte de los casos, tanto lo interlingua quanto lo neolatino han parolas semejantes. Non obstante, loro obbiettivos subjacentes conducen a differencias notables.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: En primo loco, lo interlingua include muitas parolas dello latino clássico che non se usan de toto en las lenguas romànicas, como igitur e sed.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. In between shots, the text “Igitur” and “Sed” appear next to each other, and the subtitles in different languages are also given.

scenes.audio: En secondo loco, lo interlingua ha altres parolas dello latino clássico, mais se usan de manera diferente en comparazione a las lenguas romànicas, como extra e ex.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The words “Extra” and “Ex” appear on the screen next to each other. Below them are phrases containing these words in six different languages.

scenes.audio: En terço loco, lo interlingua ha parolas que por una razone altra son differentes de las formas che se encuentran en las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Inter
scenes.visuals: The word “Inter” appears on the screen. Below, the words are shown in six different languages as in the previous keyframe.

scenes.audio: Algunos cognatos adoptan lo aspecto dello latino classico, como inter en veche de entre.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: De plus, algunas parolas non se assemblan a las formas presente en las lenguas romànicas intenzionalmente.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Tempo
scenes.visuals: The word “Tempo” is crossed out and the word “Tempore” is shown under it.  Five different language words are shown above them, as in the previous examples.

scenes.audio: É dicere, parolas como tempore en veche de tempo e corde en veche de cuore.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The word “Còre” is shown on the screen, next to “Tempo”. The word “Corde” is shown below, “Còre” is crossed out.

scenes.audio: Questo è dovuto allo fatto che los desviluppatores dello interlingua voleva mantenere una clara relacione morfológica entre los sustantivos e los adjettivos correspodentes, como temporal e cordial.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The words “Tempore” and “Corde” are shown on the screen next to each other, with arrows pointing down to “Temporal” and “Cordial”, respectively.

scenes.audio: En algunas parolas, descartan las evoluciones romànicas, como la inclusione de ove en veche de las variaciones ovecla o ovellia en neolatino.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. The Latin word “ovis” is written on the screen, with an arrow pointing to the words “Interlingua:
ove” in the left pane and another arrow pointing to the words “Neolatino:
ovecla / ovellia” in the right pane. The equation “ovis + cula = ovicula” is written above the right pane. Below these words are the corresponding words in various Romance languages and English, accompanied by their country flags.

scenes.audio: Un caso semejante con aure en veche de orecla o orelia.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. The image shows the Latin word “auris”, with an arrow pointing to the words “Interlingua:
aure” in the left pane and another arrow pointing to the words “Neolatino:
aurecla / aurelia” in the right pane. The equation “auris + cula = auricula” is written above the right pane. Below these words are the corresponding words in various Romance languages and English, accompanied by their country flags. An image of an ear is shown.

scenes.audio: Ditto questo, lo interlingua sí contiene cognatos tam bene con un aspecto romànico, principalmente gracies allo trabailo dello dottore Stanley Mulaik.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The screen shows a webpage showing a dictionary, revised by Stan Mulaik, and a sample page from the document.

scenes.audio: Plus sobre questo plus tarde… x2
scenes.visuals: The text on the screen reads “Plus sobre questo plus tarde… x2”.

scenes.audio: Meo punto principale por ahora è che en lo contesto de las lenguas romànicas, questas parolas no engloban completamente los aspectos, las evoluciones fonéticas, o las variaciones que se tropan en las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. Cartoon eyes have been superimposed over his eyes.

scenes.audio: LA GRAMMÁTICA
scenes.visuals: The text “LA GRAMMÁTICA” is displayed on a magenta background with an icon of a magnifying glass over a page next to it.

scenes.audio: La grammatica dello interlingua è molto diferente de quella de las lenguas romànicas en octo modos fundamentales.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The Interlingua flag is shown on the screen next to an unequal sign followed by the flag of Portugal, Spain, Andorra, France, Romania, and Italy.

scenes.audio: 1. LO GÉNERE
scenes.visuals:
The text “8 (ÓCTO) MODOS
FUNDAMENTALES” is displayed against a yellow background. The yellow background then displays the text “1. LO GÉNERE”.

scenes.audio: Allo interlingua le manca lo genere grammaticale dovuto alla influenza dello anglese.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. “INTERLINGUA” is written at the top left on the screen.  Below, two Interlingua sentences are written. The words “Le matre e le patre.” in the first line and “Un libro e un porta.” in the second line mean “The mother and the father.” and “A book and a door.”, respectively. The English translations are provided below.

scenes.audio: En interlingua, le matre e le patre, un libro e un porta.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The words “Le”, “le”, “Un”, and “un” are underlined in the corresponding Interlingua sentences. The word “NEOLATINO” is written on the screen next to Interlingua. Below, the corresponding Neolatino sentences are written along with the English translations below.

scenes.audio: Mais en neolatino, la matre e lo patre, un libro e una porta.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The words “La”, “lo”, “Un”, and “una” are underlined in the corresponding Neolatino sentences.

scenes.audio: 2. LA CONCORDANTIA GRAMMATICALE
scenes.visuals: The text “2. LA CONCORDANTIA GRAMMATICALE” is displayed against a yellow background.

scenes.audio: Lo neolatino ancora ha la concordantia grammaticale.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. “INTERLINGUA” is written on the screen along with the Interlingua sentence “Le libros es verde.” The English translation, “The books are green.” is shown below. The word “NEOLATINO” is written on the top right on the screen. The corresponding Neolatino sentence “Los libros son verdes.” appears on the screen along with the English translation below.

scenes.audio: En interlingua, le libros es verde, mas en neolatino, los libros son verdes.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. In the words “Los libros son verdes”, the letters “s” at the end of “los” and “libros” and the letters “es” at the end of “verdes” are underlined. The word “PLURALE” is displayed against an orange background with an upwards arrow pointing to the letters “Los” and “libros”.

scenes.audio: 3. CONJUGATIONES VERBALES
scenes.visuals: The text “3. CONJUGATIONES VERBALES” appears on a yellow background.

scenes.audio: Lo neolatino ancora ha conjugationes verbale únicas, mentre che lo interlingua las exclude.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. “INTERLINGUA” is written on the top left of the screen. The conjugation of the verb “cantar” meaning “to sing” is written in a tabular form for Interlingua. The English conjugations of the verb “to sing” are provided.

scenes.audio: Por esempio, en interlingua, io canta, tu canta, ille canta, vos canta, illes canta, nos canta.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The word “canta” is underlined for all the six conjugations.

scenes.audio: Mas neolatino, éo canto, tu cantas, elle canta, vós cantates, ellos cantan, nós cantamos.
scenes.visuals: The word “NEOLATINO” is written next to Interlingua. The conjugation of the verb “cantar” is shown for Neolatino, and the word “canta” is underlined for two of the conjugations, whereas “cantates” and “cantamos” are underlined too.

scenes.audio: Questo nos porta logicamente a la sequente differenzia.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: 4. LA ELIMINATIONE DE PRONOMES PERSONALES
scenes.visuals: The text “4. LA ELIMINATIONE DE PRONOMES PERSONALES” appears on a yellow background.

scenes.audio: En interlingua, è obligatorio lo pronome personale ante la forma conjugata dello verbo, perché sen ello, saria poco claro lo soggetto della frase.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. On the screen, the text “INTERLINGUA” is displayed. Below, it shows the Interlingua sentence “Io mangia le pomo”. The word “Io” is underlined and the Italian word “Obligatorio!” is written with an upward arrow, pointing at it. The English translation of the sentence is given below, as in previous keyframes.

scenes.audio: En neolatino, como en la majoría de las lenguas romànicas, se pote excludere lo pronome, perché lo verbo conjugato ja comunica lo soggetto.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.  The word “NEOLATINO” is shown on the screen. Below, the Neolatino sentence “Éo mangió lo pomo” is written. The word “mangió” is underlined.

scenes.audio: 5. LA EXPRESSIONE DE LO PASSATO
scenes.visuals: The text “5. LA EXPRESSIONE DE LO PASSATO” is displayed on a yellow background.

scenes.audio: En interlingua, en opposicione a lo neolatino, existe un solo tempo verbale simple che parla sobre lo passato.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. “INTERLINGUA” is written on the top left. Below, the text “Preterito símplice:
Actiones definitos et actiones indefinitos” is written.  On the right top, the text “NEOLATINO” is written. Below, the text “Preterito perfecto símplice:
Actiones definitos
Preterito imperfecto:
Actiones indefinitos” is written. The words “definitos” and “indefinitos” are underlined in the text.

scenes.audio: Mais lo neolatino ha lo pretérito perfecto símplice por actiones con un fine definito e lo pretérito imperfecto por actiones con un fine indefinito.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Per esempio, en interlingua, io camminava quando io audiva un sono, mais en neolatino esta caminando, quando audí un sono.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. The screen then displays the following:
“INTERLINGUA
Io caminnava
quando io audiva un sono.
The books are green.”
On the right side, it shows the following:
“NEOLATINO
Imperfecto
(éo) estava camminando
quando (éo) audí un sono.
Símplice”
The words imperfecto and símplice are written against an orange background.

scenes.audio: 6. LO PRESÉNTE CONTINUO
scenes.visuals: The text “6. LO PRESÉNTE CONTINUO” is displayed on a yellow background.

scenes.audio: Lo neolatino mantiene lo presente contínuo, mais lo interlingua non, dovuto alla influenza dello francese.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. On the screen, the text “INTERLINGUA” appears with the following sentences below:
“Io canta.
Io canta.”
To the right, the English sentences “I sing.” and “I am singing.” appear.

scenes.audio: En interlingua, io canta, mais en neolatino, éo estao cantando.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. “NEOLATINO” appears next to Interlingua on the screen. The following sentences are shown below:
“(Éo) canto.
(Éo) estao cantando.”
The word “estao” is underlined with a text “‘Estare’ + Gerundio” below.

scenes.audio: 7. LO MÓDO SUBJUNCTIVO
scenes.visuals: The text “7. LO MÓDO SUBJUNCTIVO” appears on a yellow background.

scenes.audio: Lo modo subjunctivo, lo modo de la irrealtate, est presente en neolatino mais en interlingua non.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The words “INTERLINGUA” and “NEOLATINO” are shown on the screen. Below them, sentences in both languages along with the English translation below are shown on the screen, as in the previous examples.

scenes.audio: En interlingua, il es importante que tu veni, mas en neolatino, ést importante que vénias.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The word “vénias” is underlined. The word “SUBJUNCTIVO” is displayed against an orange background with an arrow pointing at the word “vénias”.

scenes.audio: Observa la parola il ante la parola es.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The word “il” is underlined.

scenes.audio: Un altro exemplo. En interlingua, si io habeva plús moneta, io serea ric.
scenes.visuals:
The man continues speaking in the same shot. The screen shows:
“INTERLINGUA
Preterito símplice
Si io habeva plus moneta,
io serea ric.
If I had more money,
I would be rich.”
The word “Preterito símplice” is underlined.

scenes.audio: E neolatino, si havesse plús denaro, seria ricco.
scenes.visuals:
The screen shows:
“NEOLATINO
Subjunctivo de lo imperfecto
Si (éo) havesse plus denaro,
(éo) seria ricco.
”
The word “havesse” is underlined. The words “Subjunctivo de lo imperfecto” is underlined.

scenes.audio: Questo nos porta a la differenza finale.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: 8. PRONOMES IMPERSONALES
scenes.visuals: The text “8. PRONOMES IMPERSONALES” is displayed against a yellow background.

scenes.audio: Lo interlingua ha dos pronomes impersonales.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. “INTERLINGUA” and “NEOLATINO” are displayed on the screen, with two sentences written under each. The English translation of those sentences is given below.

scenes.audio: Lo primo è il, che se usa opcionalmente quando lo soggetto è abstracto o se revela plús tarde en la frase.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The word “il” is underlined in the Interlingua sentences on the screen. Flags of Portugal, Spain, Andorra, France, Romania, and Italy are shown next to “INTERLINGUA”.  Only the French flag has a checkmark while others have an X.

scenes.audio: Per exemplo, il es ver que io es alte.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.  The word “Il” is underlined.  The words below mean, “It is true that I am tall.”

scenes.audio: Altro exemplo è il face frígido o semplicemente face frígido.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The word “Il” is underlined. The English translation, “It is cold.” appears below.

scenes.audio: Mas en neolatino, como en la majoría de las lenguas romànicas, non existe talo pronome.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.  The translation of the second example in Neolatino, “Face frégedo.”,  is shown on the screen.

scenes.audio: Per tanto, las traducciones neolatinas sarían, è vero que so alto, face frégedo.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot.

scenes.audio: Lo secondo pronome è on, che se usa quando la identitate dello soggetto è vaga.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. On the screen, the words “INTERLINGUA” and “NEOLATINO” appear along with two examples. The corresponding English translations are provided below.

scenes.audio: Per exemplo, on crede lo que on spera.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The words “On” are underlined on the screen.

scenes.audio: En neolatino, como en moltas lenguas romànicas, questo corresponde allo uso della voce passiva, specificamente con se.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The Neolatino translation appears on the screen.

scenes.audio: Per exemplo, se crede lo que se espera.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in the same shot. The Neolatino sentence is underlined on the screen.

scenes.audio: Lo punto aquí è che questos pronomes son únicos a lo interlingua.
